description.narrative: Sector actors benefit from a political environment that is favorable to the population's access to water, sanitation and hygiene., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Women and children have access to drinking water, to improved sanitation, and they adopt good hygiene practices.

mailing-address.narrative: 18 Rue Pierre & Marie Currie Marcory Zone IV Boite Postale 443 Abidjan 04 Côte d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Sector actors benefit from a political environment that is favorable to the population’s access to water, sanitation and hygiene.

description.narrative: Through UNICEF CDI advocacy and support to Government, several strategy papers regarding safe water, sanitation, hygiene promotion and sustainability of water points are now available, as well as the sustainability compact and the inter-ministerial degree related to sector coordination. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Jan 1 2017) National budget allocated for WASH (Target is to see an increasing trend towards a defined proportion of GDP)
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existing sustainability compact or sustainability plan with evidence of continous monitoring
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) National strategy to eliminate open defecation implemented
